p: The S. alpina sample from Croatia showed the presence of high amounts of oxygenated sesquiterpenes, with a significant aldehyde fraction portion [ 1]. S. germanica essential oil samples from Serbia and Italy also showed oxygenated sesquiterpenes as the main constituents, with a sample from Serbia having a large amount of monoterpene hydrocarbons as well (11,3%) [ 17, 24].
